title: Standard form
text: The standard form of a conic with directrix $$x=\pm p$$ is r=(ep)/(1±ecosθ). The standard form of a conic with directrix $$y=\pm p$$ is r=(ep)/(1±esinθ).
speech: The standard form of a conic with directrix  x is equal to, plus or minus p  is r=(ep)/(1±ecosθ). The standard form of a conic with directrix  y, is equal to plus or minus p  is r=(ep)/(1±esinθ).

is r=(ep)/(1±ecosθ). The standard form of a conic with directrix   y, is equal to plus or minus p

title: Multiply
text: Multiply the numerator and denominator by the reciprocal of the constant in the denominator to rewrite the equation in standard form(if needed).

title: Identify
text: Identify the eccentricity e as the coefficient of the trigonometric function in the denominator.

title: Determine
text: Since cos is in the denominator, and there is an addition sign in the denominator, the directrix is in the form $$x=p$$

title: Set ep
text: Set ep equal to the value in the numerator. Plug in e, and solve for $$p$$. What is $$p$$?
